byline.contributor: Carlotta Gall contributed reporting from Tunis.

abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron vows 'full spectrum' response to terrorist attack that left 39 tourists, at least 18 of them British, dead at beach resort in Sousse, Tunisia; does not specify security measures to be taken at home or abroad but sends hundreds of police officers and forensic experts to help Tunisian authorities.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister David Cameron sent security officials and ministers to the resort in Sousse, Tunisia, where 18 Britons have been confirmed dead.

headline.main: Tunisia Attack Will Get ‘Full Spectrum’ Response, British Leader Vows
headline.print_headline: Cameron Vows a ‘Full’ Response to Attack

snippet: Prime Minister David Cameron sent security officials and ministers to the resort in Sousse, Tunisia, where 18 Britons have been confirmed dead.
